resources.string: Camera permission is required to detect bullet impacts.
Live Target is an intelligent bullet impact detection system that uses your device\'s camera and computer vision to automatically identify and track bullet holes on targets during shooting practice.
Available for both Android (with Samsung Galaxy Watch) and iOS (with Apple Watch) with full feature parity between platforms.
The app continuously monitors your target through the camera feed and alerts you when new impacts are detected, making it perfect for:
Position your device so the target is clearly visible in the camera view
Adjust settings (caliber, colors, check frequency) as needed
Fire at your target - new impacts will be automatically detected and numbered
Use \'Save\' to capture target images with impact annotations
Circle Color: Color of the circles drawn around detected impacts
Number Color: Color of the impact numbers displayed on screen
Check Frequency: How often the app compares camera frames (0.5-10 seconds)
Bullet Caliber: Sets the minimum size for impact detection (17-70 caliber)
Higher caliber = larger minimum detection size
Watch Integration: Enable/disable sending impact notifications to Samsung Galaxy Watch
Watch Status: Shows pairing and connection status
When enabled, your Galaxy Watch will receive notifications and display impact details
Red watch: Connection failed or unavailable
Gray watch: Status unknown or integration disabled
Start/Stop: Begin or end impact detection
Clear: Remove all detected impact markers from screen
Save: Capture current view with impact annotations to Photos
Zoom Controls: Use + and - buttons to adjust camera zoom
Zoom range: 1x to 20x magnification with hardware zoom support
Higher zoom provides more detail but smaller field of view
Mount device securely to minimize camera shake
Ensure target fills a good portion of the camera view
Avoid backlighting or extreme shadows on target
Position camera perpendicular to target face
Start with 2-second check frequency for most situations
Set bullet caliber close to your actual ammunition
Use contrasting colors for impact markers
Lower check frequency in bright, stable lighting
Use consistent, even lighting on target
Minimize movement around the target area
Start detection before first shot for best baseline
Clean target background improves detection accuracy
False detections: Increase bullet caliber setting or check frequency
Missed impacts: Decrease bullet caliber setting or improve lighting
Multiple detections per shot: Increase check frequency
Close other camera apps before using Live Target
Restart app if detection becomes unresponsive
Increase check frequency if device is struggling
Check that watch is paired and companion app is installed
Ensure watch integration is enabled in settings
Verify watch is connected (green watch icon)
Try tapping Start button to test connectivity
